author: mikemaccana
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

The powershell team will likely get an increase in bug reports from people running Windows Terminal, or want to see if some behavior is specific to Windows Terminal or the old terminal (which I guess is called 'console'?). You might want to add the `Terminal` as a field to `$PSVersionTable`:

```
 $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.5
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.5
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18908
Platform                       Win32NT
Terminal                       Windows Terminal (Preview) 0.6.2951.0
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Where do we can get a terminal name from?

comments.author: mikemaccana
comments.body:
@iSazonov Hrm vscode adds `$env:TERM_PROGRAM` but it looks like Terminal doesn't use that.

@DHowett-MSFT is there a way for shells to detect the Terminal?  Thanks! 🙂

comments.author: DHowett-MSFT
comments.body: Nope: microsoft/terminal#1040. There's no broadly accepted standard for identifying a terminal emulator application. :smile:

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @lzybkr @daxian-dbw Based on your PSReadline experience can you reword the request so that we could understand what useful would we add to $PSTableVersion about current terminal/console?

comments.author: daxian-dbw

title: Feature Request: add 'Terminal' to $PSVersionTable to make support requests easier.
